reviewText: Nice video, now I can have some peace and quiet while the kids are watching!!!

This is a great video describing the contents of MONSTER TRUCK CLASSICS. YOU'LL ALSO ENJOY LOTS AND LOTS OF MONSTER TRUCKS VOL. 1 PLUS ALL OF THE LOTS AND LOTS OF DVD SERIES. Just look up Lots and Lots of and you'll see the entire DVD series.Lots and Lots of Fire Trucks DVD Vol. 1Lots and Lots of Fire Trucks DVD Vol. 2Lots and Lots of Trucks Vol. 1Lots and Lots of Trucks DVD Movie Vol. 2Lots and Lots of Monster Trucks DVD Vol. 1Lots and Lots of FIRE SONGS and SAFETY TIPS DVDLots and Lots of Trains DVD Movie Vol. 2Lots and Lots of Toy Trains Volume 1 DVD MovieLots and Lots of Playful Penguins & Their Toe-Tappin Feet -All About Penguins DVD These are award-winning DVDs that make great gifts for kids of all ages and are not available in stores so order here! Kids with autism love them too because they contain lots of action shots and fun, sing-a-long music from award-winning childrens musician James Coffey.
Im 24 and I use to watch this on vhs as a kid. So cool they brought it back! This is real racing the way it should be today! Thankx

I bought this set for my Grandson's 5th birthday.  He's into all the current Monster Trucks.  We went to a small Monster Truck show.  He and his brother liked seeing older trucks and watching the races in these. Good value for 3 dvd's.
This set is somewhat "outdated".  However my small grandson enjoyed the action.  He wasn't aware of the actual timing of the events.
This collection is amazing!  My 3-year-old son loves it.  I absolutely recommend this to anyone who likes monster trucks.

Man, I had these tapes when they originally came out, I watched them all the time when I was a kid, these are the first 3 original Monster Truck shows, alot of history here, these were the real days of monster trucks, now I can watch them again, bottom line, GET THIS WHILE YOU CAN!

Monster Truck Classics 3 DVD Set is a "must have" for true Monster Truck fans! Why? You will see Monster Trucks in their glory days, mud bog action and truck & tractor pulling. In Return of the Monster Trucks, you will see the first ever side-by-side compition of Monster Trucks! There is so much more in this DVD set that will take you back in time to see were these Monster Trucks came from!
great

My boys have enjoyed this Monster Truck set since it came out on VHS.  Finding it on dvd was a great surprise.  If you are a true monster truck fan, you should have this set.  You can see where your favorite truck and/or driver was years ago.  A great addition to our Monster Truck dvd library.
I had this on VHS years ago, and I wore the tape out. Glad they brought this back.

First disc is suffering from a way too harsh JPEG compression on some pictures.
Second disc has slight dithering crap when text effects are in use.
Third disc was fine.
Won't play in DVD Player
My son loves it!!!
The first DVD has a few problems....halting for seconds at a time.  I bought these for my great grandson...something to do when he is here visiting...and that has worked out well.
I didn't realize these were the monster truck shows from the beginning of time. I wasn't impressed with any of the DVD's. But as far as the seller goes, he did all right.
These were OK, but the quality was not that good, it was not what I expected, and I will not buy them again. I bought a coupleof them at that time, and I'm sorry I did.
The 2009 date is misleading. This is old and terrible! I bought it as a gift and wish I could return it.
I choose this item because I love these monster trucks I use to wash it as a child on VHS. Now I finally can watch it on DVD!

My 2 year old son loves these videos, he asks to watch them over and over.  The variety is nice as they talk about/show all sorts of vehicles.  We have played the more recent Monster Jam events for him and he still loves the older trucks featured in these videos.

Great value...3 dvd set!!!  Great footage from the 80's!!  Purchased it for grandsons age 3 and 7, they love it!  The only time we get to see monster trucks is when they come to town twice a year but at an indoor venue which isn't great so the dvd's fill a void!
bought the dvd new, got it in the mail and the 2nd and 3rd dvd did not work and skipped in both of my dvd players.

My 4.6 yr old is all into monster trucks and he loved this one and it keeps him occupied for a good hr or so when I put it on for him .. 1 to 2 Hrs. Worth every penny lots of old school trucks from the late 70's early to mid 80's the days of the birth of monster trucks . Back when Bob Chandler was driving big foot himself (:
This was bought as a present for our grandson also. He watched it and loved every minute of it. Packaging was great and nothing was broke
Not a bad set of dvd's. They are a bit dated. Think 1980's maybe early 90's, but overall a good value. Hey if it keeps the kids interested for awhile that says something; right?

My grandsons are big into "monster trucks".  They didn't recognize any of these except for
Bigfoot.  They prefer the new ones.

My son, at the time just turned 3, was very much into monster trucks, so I bought this DVD set for him. He still watches it to this day and he is almost 6. Very good movies, and would definitely recommend to anyone who loves those big trucks!

This is an awesome collection of the first 3 television shows about monster trucks from the mid 80's! These dvd's include footage that was cut out when they were sold on video 25 years ago. Well woorth the buy.
I ordered this for my 3 year old because he saw monster trucks on tv and loved it. This is mostly talking and very little monster truck action.
Grandson age 4 loves these DVD's. Always says he wants to watch vroom vroom. Will need to buy more nana and papa are getting tired of same dvd's.

I bought this DVD as a christmas gift for my boyfriend, and he absolutly loved it, sadly tho I think in shipping the dvd case broke and when I recieved it the cd's where bouncing around inside :( but they worked just fine an we got a replacement case.

I was pretty surprised when I searched Monster Trucks here and this came up. When I was 5 or 6 my dad bought me The Return of the Monster Trucks VHS tape, which I proceeded to what I don't how many times over and still have it to this day. I had seen Battle but didn't even know there was a War. Return is the best for straight up Monster Trucks and Battle is good mix of mid-80's niche motor sports, War of the Monster Trucks was mix like The Battle but not as good.
There aren't any extras or special additions, it looks good but its really just the original VHS copy put on DVD.
If your a classic motor sports fan like me or a current Monster Truck fan and want to see the way it started, Monster Truck Classics this is a must buy, especially for the price, but be warned, the trucks are ssslllllooooooww[...]

P.S. If your an Indycar fan you'll get kick out of seeing Jack Arute in what has to be one of his earliest announcing gigs.
One DVD does even work and the other 3 you can not select any of the menu options other then "play all"

I really enjoyed watching this. I didn't like how the narrators were talking while the trucks were doing their stunts though. I would have liked to hear the trucks running and smashing the cars instead of the narrator. But, I do recommend this dvd set. It shows how the original monster trucks started it all.

Very disappointed.  Got as Christmas gift for 5 year old son.  He loves monster trucks and has other videos.  This one could not hold his attention.  It spends most of it's time on boring commentary and interviews.  Too much talking and not enough action.
Arrived promptly.  Great video.  My nephew loves it.
BETTER THAN I HAD EXPECTED. WOULD TELL ANYONE THAT KNOWS MONSTER TRUCKS AND HAS SEEM MANY EVENTS, NEEDS TO PURCHASE THIS SET.
I found this boring and repetitive, poor quality. But to be fair I'm not a long time Monster Truck fan.
I'm rather surprised that war of the monster trucks had more footage than the 30min vhs version
Great product!
Given as a gift. They said their little boy loves it.
Our grandson loves it. That makes it perfect.

This is a blast from my childhood. I saw War of the Monster Trucks, the third of these many a time as a child. It is primitive in a way to the modern day trucks but this is the genesis of the sport. Monsters did not always fly high and clear dirt mounds or hit van piles, they crushed cars, pulled sleds and ran mud bogs. I love both eras honestly. Those who think this it not good don't realize where monster trucks came from. They came from putting bigger tires on production trucks and drag racing engines under the hood. It wasn't always tube frames and fiberglass people.
MY GRANDSON ENJOYS MONSTER TRUCKS
not what I was hoping for
My grandson loves it!
Ordered this for my handicapped son was very disappointed did not receive poster
A lot of information along with great action
